title: Okay!!! I give:

title: gah
content: Read the Wikipedia article... it's an online thing involving swapping numbers in place of letters, most commonly 3 for E.  This s3nt3nc3 is partial l33t.  You can get more advanced by subbing in extra stuff, eventually replacing every letter with a set of characters.

title: Re: gah
content:
However, since twatts like me have figured this out, several new versions have been created in order to further alienate people they don't like. Some of them can be almost impossible to decipher. [Ordinary 1337 often uses ^^ for m for example, so called '|_||=)3|} !33-| [uber 1337, don't ask me how that works] uses /\/\, and there are even more complex versions out there.

So just don't bother n00b, we r 2 1337 4 joo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

-Levellord

title: Oh... I get it.
content:
Ah ha... I understand. Full immersion always works best.

[&|^ |_| [|/&[|< 7|n!5???

I'll give a prize to the person who cracks this. Most likely a beta of something I'm working on for the K:M.

Good luck.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Indeed...
content:
|_||n|_||n. 7|n&7 ! [&|^. ! 7|n||^|<...

Those Ns are unco, though.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani
